body:
1) I might be missing something but I can't see any information about which version of Python is required to actually run Spack.

My default python is 3.5 and when I run

```
./spack list
```

on current master branch it fails due to various print statements which use print without parenthesis, which is expected when you grep the repo for "print"

Can someone clarify what am I missing here ?

2) I can't find any information about what is the data source of "spack list" results.
- is it hardcoded ?
- is there a central server storing info about packages ?
- can this source be customised ?
- can you have multiple package data sources?
title: missing README info - no support for python 3.x and no info about the data source of package list
